description: I have been working at Travelex
pros: Flexible with working hours and shifts
cons: No career progression, Not many permanent opportunities
advice: Must have some incentives for achieving kpi's

description: I have been working at Travelex full-time
pros: It's quite chilled out, quite fun just can be stressful when busy and working with money
cons: A lot expected from advisors when working on a lower wage than a manager. EG advisors doing managers checks
advice: Pay bonuses or more if we do more work

description: I worked at Travelex full-time for less than a year
pros:
Work confort 
Flexible Hours 
Work from home
cons:
Everything is too slow.
There is no fun atmosphere there . It's a typical old big company Spirit.
advice: Try to motivate engineer by giving  them a more fast pace environment

description: I worked at Travelex full-time
pros: entrepreneurial atmosphere, people always wanting to get things done,
cons: without proper guidance or strong in-market direction, can feel like lots of actions happening but doesn't amount to anything overall
advice: More frequent top down communication about strategy (not just what the CEO did at the weekend) across all levels.

description: I worked at Travelex
pros: Open to opportunities to move into new roles and responsibilities if you pursue them, and generally good working culture. A company looking to grow and innovate in the FX market
cons: Remuneration isn't highly competitive. A disparate collection of business tools and MI (in lieu of a single ERP solution) can be frustrating. A clash of cultures between digital and non-digital teams
advice: Address the cultural divide between digital and non-digital teams and re-address opportunities to amalgamate business systems into a more streamlined solution

description: I worked at Travelex full-time for more than 5 years
pros:
Free parking
Sitting down job(even though the chairs are broken)
Very easy to get into
cons:
Un educated and un qualified management
No work ethics
No bonuses
No incentives
No business plan
Employee satisfaction is low
Management biased and to much in your personal space
No progression unless you are a favourite
If you speak you mind, thats it, your on the hit list
Minimum pay
No yearly pay increase
Every month they talk about bonus but you don't actually get any
You line managers only follow...
advice: Learn to respect and appreciate your employees, maybe you will make more of a business that way.

description: I worked at Travelex full-time
pros:
The work load is relatively less
Good bonus and hikes
cons:
The processes are not well setup
3 month notice period
advice: Please distribute the work among team members evenly

description: I worked at Travelex full-time for more than 5 years
pros:
The job itself is interesting and variable
Local teams are great to work with
cons:
Management structure changes to the detriment of staff interest
Communication from management at times has little to be desired.
Recruitment was outsourced causing detrimental effects to the business and health and wellbeing of staff.. constant overtime for an entire 2 years, 2 years of only taking 3/5 weeks of annual leave and no support when you advise of stress and burnout.. and the depression they caused
Support...
advice:
Ensure to get results to fix valid staff morale issues and is actually a legal requirement under the health and safety act for staff welfare.
Make sure staff dont breach the working time directive -if they do get an opt out! Again another legal requirement
Get a mental health policy  and appropriate training to all management so that all colleagues can be treated fairly, and get the support they need.

description: I worked at Travelex
pros: Nice building, good coffee, friendly staff.
cons: Stressful environment, poor mid level management, they are still trying to find their identity.
advice: Change the way of thinking from 80s retail business to XXI century digital money. Also communication is the key. Hard truth is better than beautiful lie.

description: I worked at Travelex full-time
pros: Nothing sadly.  I would look for work elsewhere.
cons: Management has no idea what they are doing and then places unreal expectations on their employees.  No business plan for success.
advice: Replace ALL management.

description: I worked at Travelex full-time for more than 10 years
pros: Travelex is a unique company to work for, combining the retail and banking world into one dynamic MSB. The spirit is friendly and entrepreneurial, willing to take on new risks and adventures and see what lies around the corner. The people who work there are generally great, and I was able to develop long-lasting connections during my many years in various roles. They strive for excellency and work together globally...
cons: The pay is not excellent in many cases, however their willingness to train and advance employees as well as the unique opportunities afforded makes up for much of this. There are very limited opportunities for advancement though - you could be there several years before changing roles. There also tends to be a lack of communication when dealing with structural changes and possible role eliminations - these are...
advice: Loyalty to long-term, knowledegable employees might serve the company better in the long run.

description: I worked at Travelex full-time for less than a year
pros: Not many customers.Get paid time in a half on holidays.
cons: Absolutely boring job. Managers are not on site. Can not leave the office to have lunch, long hours.
advice: Let your employees read books or do homework instead of locking them up in a box waiting on a customer

description: I worked at Travelex full-time for more than 3 years
pros:
Pink collar job
Good for part time Students
Part time Mothers
No education required
No experience required
Free parking
Free uniform
cons:
Rude and amateur Management
Risk of loosing your job anytime
Rude customers
Force the employees to lie to customers
False promises about bonuses 
Zero employee satisfaction
Inactive managers
Minimum UK pay scale 
Stressful job 
Loads of paper work
No career opportunities
Very little appreciation or recognition from management.
Void working for this company at all times
advice: Grow UP and learn to RESPECT

description: I have been working at Travelex full-time
pros: Lots of energy, a number of people really care about the company and it's customers. Truly global business, opportunity to meet people from around the world.
cons: Major strategic mistakes in recent years. Investment in projects that have little chance of success and have burned cash. Major structural issues.
advice: Go back to basics and mean it. Don't need such huge bloated teams. Cut your losses on investments that have zero chance of success.

description: I have been working at Travelex full-time for more than a year
role: Current Employee - Human Resources Business Partner
pros: On site visits engaging with the business partners, people analytics, engaging with other functions, interesting projects, accountability, ability to work autonomously, remote working (from home), 22 holidays which increases with length of service, BUPA membership discounts, participate in corporate social events, great team, a hands on role, a lot of focus on HR IS systems, forward thinking company that puts a lot...
cons: Limited scope for career progression, base pay below lowest market rate.  Employer matches pension only for senior level employees.  No formal career development programme for this role.  Limited secondment opportunities.
advice: Base pay should be reflective of market rates

description: I worked at Travelex part-time
pros:
Customer service.  

Cash handling experience.
cons:
Poor standard of training for new starters.

Long hours for very little pay.

Bad managers and clicky co-workers.
advice:
Train new starters properly and then you won't have problems later on. 

Encourage employees instead of criticising.

description: I worked at Travelex full-time for more than a year
role: Former Employee - IT Service Desk Analyst
pros: Good exposure to AD, Exchange etc
cons: Managment are terrible, low pay, benefits good be better, no flexibilty, no appreciation for work, you have to brown nose to get any where, no career progression. One of the worst companies I've ever worked for - and that's even after Amazon Warehouse!
advice: The list is endless; listen to your staff more, show more appreciation, stop trying to suck your workers dry, speak to them with respect, be flexible

description: I have been working at Travelex
pros: flexibilty hrs,good rates,friendly team and great management
cons: no progression in the career
advice: everthing is good

description: I worked at Travelex full-time
pros: its a good job to start
cons: no opportunity to grow with the company
advice: create an opportunity for your employees to grow

description: I have been working at Travelex
pros: Management team are approachable and respect their staff whatever level you are. Salary is good with location pay.
cons: Can be stressful as busy in summer and boring in winter as long tines on your own. Tesco store staff are not very friendly.
advice: More support in summer needed and more to do when it is quieter would help. More staff in general as can be long times on own.

description: I worked at Travelex part-time for more than a year
role: Former Employee - Tesco Money Travel Money Advisor
pros: Always busy, fun working with customers, great colleagues, supportive manager.
cons: A lot of responsibility for minimum wage, expected to hit targets with no incentive, not allowed to use staff canteen or have staff perks although you are branded as Tesco.
advice: Incentive to upsell and get customers in would be much higher if bonuses were given.

description: I worked at Travelex
pros: Great people, interesting work, learn about all different currencies.
cons: Most employees are through Staffing company with little benefits
advice: Hire on some of your team members that have been then for a while.

description: I have been working at Travelex  for more than a year
pros:
Sales Consultants work in Teams
Environmental friendly
Established lasting relationship with our customers
Serving our customers is our priority
cons: Some of the locations should be enlarged
advice: Spend much time with new hires

description: I worked at Travelex
pros: Free parking at Tesco Store
cons: Bad management, awful pay, bulling and harassment from management, no recognition of good work,
advice: Listen to frontline staff!

description: I have been working at Travelex
pros: Managers not in any way approachable. God forbid if you do, they make you feel like a five year old if you ask them a question that they think you should already know the answer to. Training is very poor. Staff retention not good. No recognition programme in place. Morale low. Learn to treat your staff with respect.
cons:
The people you work with (excluding management) are wonderful.
On-site free car park
Canteen
advice: Respect your staff. I know you think we are 'ten a penny' but at end of the day we are humans and wish to be treated as such!

description: I worked at Travelex
pros: Get to work with a diverse team and get to speak to some interesting customers.
cons:
Company does not care about front line staff at all, no incentives, no appreciate.  You are treated like robots, or just another number.
It was demoralising and depressing working for them.
Absolutely no opportunities for progression.
Would never ever recommend this company, nor would I ever return even if they paid me £1m+ a year.
My advise to anyone applying for a sales consultant role - STAY AWAY!
advice: Appreciating your front line staff can go a long way.  Keep your staff happy and they will keep your customers happy - simple!

description: I have been working at Travelex
pros: Very nice company to work for
cons: The salary should be more, it's a lot of responsibility
advice: Nothing to say

description: I worked at Travelex
pros: some friendly colleagues. Relaxed environment
cons: Poor / non existing management . Unprofessional . Constant downsizing . Over worked. Unstable workplace
advice: Need to hire better managers and provide training and support

description: I worked at Travelex  for more than 3 years
pros: nice company for someone to start a career with since you get opportunites to move ahead in your career
cons: overtimes are a bit tiring since you are sitting in the same chair for hours and hours whenever it is busy, overtime is also paid the same rate
advice: targets are achievable but if the branch hits the target should be rewarded equally

description: I have been working at Travelex full-time for more than 3 years
pros: Establishing face to face relationships with customers, hearing about their holiday plans, advising them on their currency purchases.
cons: Spend your time trapped in a tiny box, usually alone.  Single terminal sites mean that you have to fit in serving customers around checking paperwork on a daily, weekly, monthly basis.  Pointless rules and procedures gradually kill your enthusiasm and passion for your business.  The salary does not compensate for the mind numbing routine.  Busy periods mean that you are unable to leave the box for your lunch breaks...
advice: Make every location a double terminal operation. Make boxes bigger.  Allow sites to close at an advertised time every day to enable staff to take a lunch break and leave the box for their 30 minutes break.  Managers should not be expected to try and serve customers while performing management tasks/checks, TMA's should be serving on one terminal to allow managers to get on with their own work on a second terminal...

description: I have been working at Travelex full-time
pros: Travelex is a really great and rewarding company to work for, plenty of opportunities exist to enhance ones career.  There is an excellent support network consisting of mangers, team leaders, trainers and consultants which together create a great and healthy working environment.
cons: Nothing significant to mention at present
advice: Continue the good work

description: I worked at Travelex
pros: Met some good people here. They never stay long, though.
cons: Monotonous, demotivating work on the floor. Team Leaders/Management are cliquey and narrow minded - you will only progress your career if you suck up to them. People are unhappy, pay is very, very poor, and there's really not much to get you up in the morning.
advice: A pool table doesn't = an engaged workforce. Do you actually know (or care about) your employees and what they want from a career?

description: I have been working at Travelex part-time for more than 3 years
pros: Autonomy,great if you love working on your own without constantly having someone peer over your shoulder. Interesting work environment lots to learn
cons: Seriously underpaid job, dreadful new rostering system that simply DOES NOT work, your voice is NEVER heard,old computers, everything run down,no uniform no stationary no help no backup being uncompetitive makes it virtually impossible to achieve ridiculous KPIS . Can be very very lonely at times. Would help if a lunchtime relief came in to breakup the day.
advice: Needs serious shakeup. You've gotten rid of most of your frontline staff management shakedown needs a good look at

description: I have been working at Travelex
pros: There are no pros at all!
cons: This is the worse company to ever work with. They discriminate race, have no concern for employees, treat you like utter rubbish!
advice: Train all managers, especially in t5 VAT! I have NEVER experienced racial discrimination, expect when I landed myself in Travelex. They have no shame whatsoever and treat us like dirt! Never again!!

description: I have been working at Travelex full-time
pros: Benefits, Incentives, co-workers, vacation time, flexible schedule (depending on location,staff and management)
cons: Crappy rates, not enough workers, careless managers and low pay rate, and dead end job.
advice:
Travelex can be a fun place but It depends on your manager, location and co-workers.  Also you have to make it fun. For me, it use to be fun but now it isn't anymore. 

This company has changed drastically. Management has cracked down on everyone. Sales, write ups and auditing. The company is even more frugal than ever. 


Travelex wants you to sell more than ever which isn't bad for a company. But also, not...

description: I have been working at Travelex
pros:
Quite relaxing in the fact you don't constantly have customers, that could be a pro or a con.
Still always procedures and paperwork to do
cons:
Not as well paid as it should be for the level of training required and procedures that need to be adhered.
Can be quite boring and monotonous
advice: Pay the living wage and pursue a more environmentally friendly business in terms of recycling paper work and not unnecessarily printing out paper work every day for daily checks

description: I have been working at Travelex part-time for more than a year
pros: Good pay, decent benefits. Very easy job, as all you do is convert money. Bonus is easy to get.
cons: Very boring when you don't have customers. Schedules were not as flexible as I wish they were.
advice: Umm, not anything I would say to management. Maybe work on hiring more people so that the schedules can be more flexible for people.

description: I worked at Travelex full-time for less than a year
pros:
Benefits at dozens of different retailers through Bupa Corporate Discount (although the sites are aimed at people who are on more than minimum wage). 

Asda Travel Money Bonus Scheme (Although they are changing the Revenue % so the target is more difficult to achieve).
cons:
Wage - The wage was recently raised to £7.20 an hour... Yes the National Living Wage. Considering the responsibility you have, they expect loads from you for this. Why would you want to work on this wage and be expected to be a pushy sales person when you could work on a checkout at a supermarket and have an easier life? 

HR/Payroll - This is a shambles. I do not know of words strong enough to describe how much...
advice: Train and discipline staff correctly. Staff are getting the minimum training and management are expecting them to be the best they possibly can be. The Support Trainer role is a farce and not for for purpose. The information taken from the "Training Session" could easily be found with a quick Google search and I was trained on this several years ago with much more detail and was much more worth while. Senior...

description: I worked at Travelex full-time for more than 3 years
pros: Work with different people and get to meet lots of people from all walks of life. Staff are very friendly and warm.
cons: Salary. Early starts can be tough when you have not done them before. Shift work is not for everyone. Salary is not great.
advice: Na

description: I have been working at Travelex part-time for more than 3 years
pros: Great training programme, team members are always helpful for the same goal! Highly recommended for sales people, who can kill KPI.
cons: KPI and compliance sometimes make people stressful, and for most of the time, you have to work along in single branch.
advice: Solve the potential conflict on individual KPI between staff in the same branch.

description: I have been working at Travelex
pros:
Good Hours
They like to make sure that the employee is happy with their working hours if not they are very flexible but depending on your availability
cons: They are not that many but the main one is the they are always short on supplies such as stamps and bags. Staff is always leaving as the pay is bad.
advice: Fix up before all the employees leave and please don't hire any more immigrants.

description: I have been working at Travelex part-time for more than a year
pros: Flexible hours, decent pay, incentives work by yourself.
cons: No room for moving up benifits suck!
advice: Need consistency with your employees

description: I worked at Travelex  for more than a year
pros:
Chance to work full-time
work separate from manager
Lots of down time between customers
good experience in customer service, managing a large cash drawer and sales
able to work on homework or do other things as long as you are being professional and aide customers as soon as they arrive
cons:
Waiting between customers can be tedious and boring
schedule is completed a month in advance and only having a few other coworkers at a location may limit possibilities to ask for time off
advice: Some of the tactics and products they wanted us to employ, seemed counterproductive in my opinion. Many times making the pitch as I was taught was more likely to hurt, rather than help the sale.

description: I worked at Travelex full-time
pros: Good experience. Great Brand.
cons: People don't make an effort with one another, and there is a poor culture within the finance department stemming from top management.
advice: Show your employees are care about them.

description: I worked at Travelex full-time for more than a year
pros:
- Staff that you work with on the help desks
- Location
- There are some fairly simple parts to the job
- Free Parking
- On-site canteen
- Entry level and can at least get you some experience.
cons:
Where to start...

Poor pay - A lot of the Sales/CSR/CSS's are routinely made to do extra work for no extra pay, except for "time-in-lieu" which they're not always even allowed to use - CSR's specifically have been made to take on various elements of different departments on top of the strenuous workloads they already have. Some of the managerial staff are paid way higher than what their job titles should offer...
advice:
Revise the training process and provide easy-to-use information on all of the major procedures, you only sort of do this currently and it's nowhere near to the standard that it could be.

Have newcomer's log in's ready for their programmes immediately.

Update your intranet.

Be nicer to staff

Consider cash for overtime. 

Offer some of your more experienced employees higher positions
Find ways of...

description: I have been working at Travelex part-time for less than a year
pros: The job is very easy. The managers are very flexible with the scheduling and will make accommodations if the need arises.
cons: It can be very slow at times.. I find myself bored and looking for something to do 80% of the time
advice: Find more things for the associates to do during down time, and develop an actual training schedule so new associates aren't wandering in the dark

description: I have been working at Travelex full-time
pros: Nice building, nice cafe and toilets
cons: What a ridiculous company - I have been bullied from day 1 when Instarted here. My skills are discredited daily - I have been taken upon breaks for toilet, call for taxi (11 seconds) and not supported at all. Initial questions Inhad when I started were frown upon. I am given a message daily that I should shut up and face someone else's opinion of me and explain myself. Regretting I ever came here.
advice:
The worst company I have ever worked for in last 15 years. Never experienced so
Much hostility, unfriendliness and pettiness. It is allowed that such behaviour affects projects and deadlines. Never seen such unprofessional environment.

description: I worked at Travelex full-time for less than a year
pros: At least 20 words before this will submit tnet are absolutely none other than Great workmates, who I miss but am so relieved to have escaped that hell hole
cons: Exploited on every level. Ruled by rules and regulations, cameras, dual control everything, sign this sign that, weak management  (overworked underpaid to be fair). Complete lack of trust in staff who work for minimum wage at all hours of day and night, lucky if you get a break let alone a lunch due to lack of staff. Target driven insurance and phonecard sales, pressure to sell sell sell at all costs. Don't invest...
advice: Fair days pay for a hard days work, trust in staff they actually can do it without you looking over their shoulder or spying via cctv!!

description: I worked at Travelex full-time for more than 5 years
pros:
Shift pattern is good- lots of days off.
Colleagues were great to work with.
Free uniform- though kind of expected.
cons:
Poor pay- far below the Living Wage.
Unfriendly and distant management.
Feel uncomfortable as VAT customers almost forced to take currency. When I started the job was about VAT- providing a professional service where customers had a completely free choice of taking Pounds or currency. Over time, the company has implemented procedures making it unnecessarily complicated for customers to take Pounds and VAT is now...
advice: Realise that VAT is not FX and that customers do not want to be inconvenienced or lied to when taking their refund in Pounds Sterling.

description: I worked at Travelex full-time for less than a year
pros:
Different shifts available flexible at times.
Some staff are great to work with
cons:
Unrealistic expectations  for growth being >20% year on year most targets are unreachable
company seems to want to cut cost whenever possible e.g no uniforms provided to staff, barely able to afford pens constant management change for the state recruitment of sales managers are poor
advice: get a reality check

description: I worked at Travelex
pros: good schedule, good benefits if you get to them, good starting pay rate, some days are slow and you still get your hourly wage.
cons: management is too pushy, unrealistic sales goals, stressful and not OK as a long term career employer. not motivating enough.
advice: be more realistic about the sales targets and train your staff better otherwise they'll just continue to be unhappy.

description: I worked at Travelex  for less than a year
pros: Job location was ideal. The people were great and a lot of beautiful international women.
cons: The pay was low. But great for high school graduates.
advice: Spend money on parties.

description: I worked at Travelex full-time
pros: The main manageress is lovely when she gets round to noticing you - so many people come and go that she doesn't even look at you until you've been there 3 or 4 months.
cons: Pay is so low it should be illegal and no matter how many years you work there, you will always stay on a rolling 6 month contract.  No security, no mortgages for young people and you have a 24 year old deputy manager who can't cope with the work load that has been dumped on her.
advice: Needs a drastic change - people are not numbers, they are human beings

description: I have been working at Travelex part-time for more than a year
pros:
flexible working hours.  Rate of pay is moving in right direction. most of the customers are lovely.
Lovely work colleagues.
cons: Long opening hours. Working by yourself most of the time. Far too many pointless rules and regulations which are always changing and it can be difficult to keep up with. Too few staff. Not enough managers. Rate of pay could be much better.
advice: Employ more staff including management. Increase the pay to reflect the amount of responsiblity the job entails. Make all bureaux dual till so you aren't always working alone

description: I worked at Travelex
pros: Great people, Great Offices, Good Bonus, Good Salary, Friendly Environment.
cons: Bad hours in my department, moving IT to India, Little or no progression available in some areas (Partly due to management staff staying in their positions for a long time)
advice: Think about how you can invest in and better your staff to retain them. Even if opportunities for job progression are limited, offer staff the chance to gain additional qualifications to better their career relevant skills yearly so they are always working towards something new.

description: I have been working at Travelex
pros: It's not a hard job.
cons: The management is very inconsistent.
advice: Be more consistent and understanding of the staff

description: I worked at Travelex
pros: No pros atall avoid at all costs! Sat in a tiny box all day with rude customers you basically have to take on a mangers role
cons: I worked here for 3 months and have been underpaid by hundreds of pounds each time the company is a disgrace to work for
advice: Do not work here it's a disgrace the company do not care for you atall and managers are horrible to employees!

description: I have been working at Travelex full-time for more than 8 years
pros: Flexible schedule, benefits even though they have trended down in recent years,
cons: Very limited advancements, pay and pay merits,
advice: Strive to maintain positive employees by listening to their opinions.

description: I have been working at Travelex full-time
pros: If you like to deal with the money as I do , that is a great place to work at. Usual contract 36hours.
cons: very low salary for a new joiners and constant rotation due to many leavers. Lack of incentive . Shift patterns for some could be an advantage for others disadvantage.
advice: Management  should support people at all levels  and make sure they will be happy at work. People should feel as a part of great operation  , should feel needed not used .

description: I have been working at Travelex
pros: Bonus scheme and the great rates given to staff for travel money.
cons: Not all shift workers get shift disturbance allowance.
advice: Manage.

description: I worked at Travelex full-time
pros: Had a great mentor until he left.
cons: Company constantly being flipped, no stability or long-term vision.
advice: I have no advice to give.
